comments.commentBody: The NYT writers just can't seem to help themselves when it comes to ARod gossip. Write about baseball, guys. That's why people read the Bats blog.

Mildly disagreeing with John M. Sweeney, I think the Mets can finish third, probably with 83 or so wins. I think their #2, #3, and #4 starters have a lot to prove, but without the massive injuries of last year, they should be able to get back to moderate respectability. I'm seeing Philadelphia as an easy division winner, with Atlanta back in the playoffs as the wild card. I like Florida's talent, but have a hunch that this'll be the year that their ownership melts down again, and trades away players about to make big money.

That being said, it's gonna be a delight seeing Jose Reyes back at full strength and full speed...he is one of the most fun players to watch in years.

Some of the stories I read about Rodriguez seem to imply that most of his contact with Yankees' management is through "his people." Is Rodriguez really off on his own bus so much that his manager and GM can't talk to him about this stuff?

It is time for the United Satates to realize that Sunnis are its real allies and only allies in Iraq. It is funny to see Americans fight Sunnis and then have to rely on them to curb the Iranian influence in the region. If Maliki or the Shia alliance have won the elections, the U.S. will hardly be able to do anything to protect it's mediocre allies in the region and Iran's borders would've practically reached nothern Israel. The stupidity that Iraq was governed with after the war is really amazing, and if the U.S. doesn't encourage the millions of Iraqis abroad, in Syria and Jordan to return, these recent gains will only be another opportunity to weild influence being wasted.
Just tell them:  "Here's what you voted for.  Goodbye."

To: 2 Coleman

"free elections in iraq.
nuclear weapons development in iran.
north korea firing torpedoes on a south korean navy ship.
and the count on the axis of evil remains:
one down, two to go."

As long as the "Center" of Evil, the USA is there, new axes will be created. Don't worry. It will have a long life!
Time to leave for sure.
Al-Maliki's philosophy of "elections only count when I'm the winner" meshes very well with that of the GOP and the tea party clan.  What good is democracy if only one outcome is considered valid?

totally agree with twoberry #34, stan #41, and steve #44, but even after more than 50 years of this hobby/obsession, getting this mother in 20 minutes is truly impressive...i had to get some shuteye at 4 am and finish this morning...i don't dare look at the fast first finishers list...they've all gotta be lying, dontcha think?
nice to meet you, mean old lady.
and btw, bob #18, very sly how you squeezed that "t" into 'wondertful"!
on to saturday & the acrostic!

Great story Daniel. I loved that you talked about the "age of Wonder" when you heard something for the first time and it so moved you. "knocked sideways by dangerous sounds". To me that's what music is all about. Great music always Creates that wonder.

I'm going to download the Amazon application for my netbook and my wife's laptop, and maybe start doing some more reading.
********
Yawn. We all have laptops, but reading on them is cumbersome. The market agrees, because ebook sales are very low precisely because there is not a good alternative to the laptop. I believe the iPad will begin to bridge that gap.

Verizon wireless has the same program but currently their repeater does not support 3G.
Americans, when you call your friend with your cellphone and your friend answers on his cellphone, you BOTH pay!

Not that way in the "regulated" Europe! Suckers for no regulation! Palin that!
I don't understand what the gripe is. I didn't take out an ATT mobile phone account because of all the problems my friends have with theirs. I'm very happy with my reception of my T-Mobile phone. :-)

I have this product and it's great. I am in one of the test markets and although I paid $150, I got a $100 visa gift card rebate. Plus a $50 credit for having an AT&T land-line and DSL, so it was basically free. I also received $10 Cash for filling out an online survey (Yes, they sent a ten dollar bill).

The Micro-Cell works great but needs to be close to a window so the GPS will work, not sure why it needs GSP, other than to make sure they know your location. It does drop out from time to time (not on a call) and I'm not sure why but it's rare. You can tell you are connected because your iphone will say M-Cell at the top.

There is no $20 monthly charge or any additional charge at all. Perhaps because I have an AT&T land-line and DSL but I know that when I'm on the micro-cell, I don't use voice minutes on call (or data) because of the land-line. This is their way to prevent you from dropping the land-line since you can suddenly get a great signal at home.

Bottom line, I highly recommend this product to anyone with spotty coverage at home.
Come on ATT you can do better.  SPRINT offers AIRAVE @ $100 purchase with $5/month fee.  But Sprint's Premier accounts have all charges waived. Now that's service.
one yiddish curse translated into I've got you in the bathtub. anyone explain that?

I would bet my last dime that any Republican claiming harrassment, threats or violence these days put someone up to it.  They have been lying to us so easily for years now and they have become so good at deflecting honest criticism or chasing away the facts, that claims they too are being threatened just don't wash.
In other words, it was a lot of baloney, meant to divert attention from the violent consequences of the Republican hate campaign, which had spun out of control.

It is truly amazing, the non-stop news coverage of Palin; she has done nothing to receive the coverage and the crowds at her book-signings and speeches. One can only surmise that it is done to create and stir up resentment...emotional food for bloggers to further the built-up frustrations of political adversaries.

She has been there and lost, along side Sen. McCain; she is finished as far as a national role in Washington...yet the coverage is unrelenting.

On the flip-side, Scott Brown clearly a winner, who attracted national attention, by beating the Democratic stronghold in Massachusetts...becoming the first Republican Senator to win in that state in some 40 plus years. His news coverage would be equivalent to 2 minutes, compared to Palins coverage.

Surely if there was a positive story and a career to follow... it would be the Scott Brown story.

It is hard these days to believe Cantor or any Republican.
It is easy to imagine that this was all trumped up so that the Republicans
can yap that they are receiving the same treatment as the Democrats.If they continue to be driven by right wing extremists they will lose all
creditability as a major political party.
A party of "Hell No" is not serving the best interest of our country.
Until they can claim that President Obama is OUR President.... and not
YOUR President.... they are losers.
How could any woman support this bill w/ its gender discrimination in premiums and denial of access to reproductive care for women

As I saw McCain/Palin standing together all I could think was....
thank goodness that they are not sitting in the White House.

It's the  People that bothers me. They let these Flem flam men take over their brain! There is not one i would listen to ,and believe! But most People just take their word for everything, and they have gotten to were they are by lying! Great examples for our Kids! Take time to check everything out before you believe what you hear! Technology  makes it easy!!

@#1, get a case for the drops.
@#2, only the 3GS shoots video out of the box; the others can shoot video with 3rd party apps.
@#3, I think the writer means to give an iPhone that is no longer being used as a phone, so the cell radio is OFF.
@#4, absolutely, the Flip takes better video. I think if given a choice, a child will always carry an iPhone with them, to while away time, while the Flip is something they might leave behind. Why I believe that, is the author makes two points; one, the novelty factor. He clearly is concerned the kids may leave the Flip behind. Two, he mentions the videolog, and the best camera is the one you have with you. Clearly, the iPhone is not as good a video cam as a Flip, but, it may be something they keep in their pocket when they want to document something in their lives.
Personally, I like Republicans – there are 3: Todd Harris, David Brooks and now Frum. At this rate, in about 78 years I could vote for one.
